ygData.subject: Something to fear
ygData.msgSnippet: The little mine was nothing very exciting. Only a few dozen workers lived there, and most of them worked for the New Source Company, a prospection agency that

Subject: Something to fear
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=225937926; y=Eiqrw1Sayr4JgF_IKPGbA_MxovB16ZgdVH72pX9LN_voHojnfJbf

The little mine was nothing very exciting. Only a few dozen workers
lived there, and most of them worked for the New Source Company, a
prospection agency that tried to discover new energon veins. It was
not very important, but it was profitable enough for the company to
continue developping it.

The evening shift was just finishing and a group of miners was coming
out of the mine, telling raunchy jokes and laughing.

It all happened suddenly. The bombardment alert came on, and someone
frantically warned about a meteor shower falling down, warning the
Pentatron office at the same time. The bots scrambled, trying to get
to cover, but it was too late.

Meteors were falling like a hailstorm. Most of the bots were crippled,
and one even received a burning crystal rock in the back, a massive
crystal jutting out of his chest. Then, a huge one fell, entered the
mine and created a huge energon-boosted explosion. The
meteor-traversed worker turned around, and saw a rolling fire wave. He
saw the sparks of his comrades leaving them, yet his did not go. Why?
The fire engulfed him, then formed a vortex all around him. The sparks
whirled down the spiral and lodged themselves in his crystal. He was
losing himself, yet becoming something else.

Who was he?

An answer came.

Wyldfire.
